thread.title: Warning sets back Adgorithms’ plan to ‘take over world’
thread.title_full: Warning sets back Adgorithms’ plan to ‘take over world’

title: Warning sets back Adgorithms’ plan to ‘take over world’
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Warning sets back Adgorithms’ plan to ‘take over world’ Or Shani, right, the Adgorithms founder, is upbeat about prospects for Albert Or Shani, right, the Adgorithms founder, is upbeat about prospects for Albert Simon English Deputy Business Editor Published at 12:01AM, October 10 2015 
Shares in an internet software group crashed yesterday after a sudden profit warning blamed on “severe disruption” in the online advertising market. 
Adgorithms floated on AIM in June with help from bankers at Liberum, raising £27 million to expand. At that point it was valued at £82 million. 
The shares tumbled 60 per cent after the group said earnings would be “materially below market expectations”. They closed down 77p at 49p. 
Before the warning, the City was expecting profits of around £7 million for the year. 
The paper fortune of Or Shani, the founder and chief executive, was hit as Subscribe now
